title: Taiwan’s Bomb Shelters: ‘A Space for Life. And a Space for Death.’
description: Preparing for war over hundreds of years has left a mark on the island, with its hundreds of bomb shelters. Some are being turned into cultural oases.
dc:creator: Damien Cave and Amy Chang Chien

media:content.media:credit: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A bunker that has been converted into a temple in Keelung, Taiwan.
